place.name: PRIORS HARDWICK
place.gazetteerText: HARDWICK-PRIORS, a parish in Southam district, Warwickshire; adjacent to Northamptonshire and to the Oxford canal, 4 miles NE of Fenny-Compton r. station, and 5 SE by S of Southam. Post-town, Priors-Marston, under Daventry. Acres, 1,600. Real property, £2,901. Pop., 323. Houses, 65. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £240.* Patron, Earl Spencer. The church is early and decorated English, in tolerable condition. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
